unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Adversaries can modify the job definition to make the job appear legitimate, effectively hiding malicious activities within a seemingly benign job.
Updating a job definition can include instructions to remove or alter logs and other artifacts, helping adversaries evade detection.
Adversaries can update the job definition to include specific conditions or constraints, ensuring the job only executes under certain circumstances, which helps in evading detection.
Adversaries can alter the job definition to manipulate data processed by the Glue job, affecting the integrity and outcome of the data workflows.
By altering job definitions, adversaries can repurpose AWS Glue jobs for their own computational needs, impacting the resource allocation of the environment.

securityImplications: Attackers might use UpdateJob to modify Glue job parameters, potentially disrupting data processing or injecting malicious code.
